sections.title: Modal Verbs Nedir?
sections.content: Modal verbs (kiplik yardımcı fiiller), yetkinlik, olasılık, izin, zorunluluk, tavsiye gibi anlamları ifade eden özel yardımcı fiillerdir. YDS'de modal verbs hem doğrudan sorularla hem de okuma parçalarında nüans anlamayı gerektirir.
sections.turkish_explanation: Modal verbs ana fiilin anlamını değiştirir veya ona ek anlam katar. Türkçe'de '-ebilir', '-meli', '-malı' gibi eklerle ifade edilen kavramları İngilizce'de modal verbs karşılar.

sections.title: Main Modal Verbs and Their Meanings
sections.content:
**Can/Could (Yetkinlik, Olasılık, İzin)**

• Can: Şimdiki zamanda yetkinlik veya olasılık
  - She can speak three languages. (Üç dil konuşabilir.)
  - It can be dangerous. (Tehlikeli olabilir.)

• Could: Geçmiş yetkinlik, nazik istek, daha az kesin olasılık
  - I could swim when I was five. (Beş yaşındayken yüzebiliyordum.)
  - Could you help me? (Bana yardım eder misiniz?)
  - It could be true. (Doğru olabilir - kesin değil.)

**May/Might (Olasılık, İzin)**

• May: Orta derecede olasılık, resmi izin
  - It may rain tomorrow. (Yarın yağmur yağabilir.)
  - You may enter now. (Şimdi girebilirsiniz.)

• Might: Daha düşük olasılık, nazik öneri
  - She might come to the party. (Partiye gelebilir - daha az olası.)
  - You might want to check this. (Bunu kontrol etmek isteyebilirsiniz.)

**Must/Have to (Zorunluluk, Kesin Çıkarım)**

• Must: Güçlü zorunluluk, kesin çıkarım
  - Students must attend all classes. (Öğrenciler tüm derslere katılmalıdır.)
  - She must be tired. (Yorgun olmalı - kesin çıkarım.)

• Have to: Dış kaynaklı zorunluluk
  - I have to work tomorrow. (Yarın çalışmak zorundayım.)
  - We had to leave early. (Erken ayrılmak zorunda kaldık.)

**Should/Ought to (Tavsiye, Beklenti)**

• Should: Tavsiye, beklenti
  - You should exercise regularly. (Düzenli egzersiz yapmalısınız.)
  - The report should be ready by Friday. (Rapor Cuma'ya hazır olmalı.)

• Ought to: Should ile aynı ama daha resmi
  - We ought to inform them. (Onları bilgilendirmeliyiz.)

**Will/Would (Gelecek, Nazik İstek, Alışkanlık)**

• Will: Gelecek, istek, ani karar
  - The conference will start at 9 AM. (Konferans sabah 9'da başlayacak.)
  - Will you join us? (Bize katılır mısınız?)

• Would: Nazik istek, geçmiş alışkanlık, koşullu
  - Would you mind closing the door? (Kapıyı kapatır mısınız?)
  - He would always arrive early. (Her zaman erken gelirdi.)

**Shall (Öneri, Resmi Gelecek)**

• Shall: Öneri (I/we ile), resmi gelecek
  - Shall we begin? (Başlayalım mı?)
  - The meeting shall commence at noon. (Toplantı öğleden başlayacaktır.)

sections.title: Modal Verbs in Past Forms
sections.content:
**Modal Perfect (Modal + have + past participle)**

Bu yapı geçmişteki durumlar hakkında olasılık, pişmanlık veya eleştiri ifade eder:

**Must have (Geçmişte kesin çıkarım):**
- She must have forgotten the meeting. (Toplantıyı unutmuş olmalı.)
- They must have arrived by now. (Şimdiye kadar varmış olmalılar.)

**May/Might have (Geçmişte olasılık):**
- He may have missed the train. (Treni kaçırmış olabilir.)
- She might have called while I was out. (Ben dışarıdayken aramış olabilir.)

**Could have (Geçmişte yetkinlik ama gerçekleşmedi):**
- You could have told me earlier. (Bana daha önce söyleyebilirdin - ama söylemedin.)
- She could have been a doctor. (Doktor olabilirdi - ama olmadı.)

**Should/Ought to have (Geçmişte tavsiye, pişmanlık):**
- I should have studied harder. (Daha çok çalışmalıydım - pişmanlık.)
- They ought to have informed us. (Bizi bilgilendirmelilerdi.)

**Would have (Koşullu geçmiş):**
- I would have helped if I had known. (Bilseydim yardım ederdim.)
- She would have succeeded with more support. (Daha fazla destekle başarılı olurdu.)

**Can't/Couldn't have (Geçmişte imkansızlık):**
- She can't have finished already. (Şimdiden bitirmiş olamaz.)
- He couldn't have stolen it. (Onu çalmış olamaz.)

sections.title: Degrees of Certainty (Kesinlik Dereceleri)
sections.content:
Modal verbs farklı kesinlik dereceleri ifade eder:

**100% Kesin (Certain):**
- Will/Won't: It will rain tomorrow. (Yarın yağmur yağacak.)
- Must: He must be at work now. (Şimdi işte olmalı.)
- Can't: She can't be serious. (Ciddi olamaz.)

**Oldukça Kesin (Probable - %75-90):**
- Should/Ought to: The results should be ready soon. (Sonuçlar yakında hazır olmalı.)
- Shouldn't: It shouldn't take long. (Uzun sürmemeli.)

**Muhtemelen (Possible - %50-75):**
- May/Might: She may come later. (Sonra gelebilir.)
- Could: It could be true. (Doğru olabilir.)
- May not/Might not: They might not agree. (Kabul etmeyebilirler.)

**YDS'de Kesinlik Soruları:**
YDS sınavında modal verbs ile ilgili sorular genellikle konuşmacının kesinlik derecesini anlamayı gerektirir:

- "The author's use of 'may' suggests..." (Yazarın 'may' kullanımı ... anlamına gelir.)
- "Which modal best expresses certainty?" (Hangi modal kesinlik ifade eder?)

sections.title: Common Modal Verb Rules
sections.content:
**1. Modal verbs sonrasında bare infinitive kullanılır (to olmadan):**
- ✓ She can speak English.
- ✗ She can to speak English.

**2. Modal verbs 3. tekil şahıslarda değişmez (s/es almaz):**
- ✓ He must go.
- ✗ He musts go.

**3. Olumsuz yapılar:**
- Cannot → can't (tek kelime)
- Must not → mustn't (yasak)
- Should not → shouldn't
- Will not → won't

**4. Soru yapıları (modal + subject + verb):**
- Can you help me?
- Should we leave now?
- Must they attend?

**5. Have to vs Must farkı:**
- Must: İç motivasyon, kişisel zorunluluk
  - I must finish this today. (Kendim istiyorum.)
- Have to: Dış zorunluluk, kural
  - I have to wear a uniform. (Kural gereği.)

**6. Mustn't vs Don't have to:**
- Mustn't: Yasak
  - You mustn't smoke here. (Yasak.)
- Don't have to: Zorunlu değil
  - You don't have to come. (Gelmek zorunda değilsin.)

**7. Could vs Was able to (geçmiş yetkinlik):**
- Could: Genel yetkinlik
  - I could swim when I was young. (Gençken yüzebilirdim.)
- Was able to: Belirli bir durumda başarı
  - I was able to finish the project. (Projeyi bitirebildim - belirli durum.)

sections.title: YDS-Specific Modal Usage
sections.content:
**Academic Writing'de Modal Kullanımı:**

YDS okuma parçaları akademik metinler içerir. Akademik dilde modal verbs farklı kullanılır:

**Hedging (Kesinlikten kaçınma):**
- May/Might/Could: The results may indicate... (Sonuçlar gösterebilir...)
- Would: This would suggest... (Bu öneriyor olabilir...)

**Recommendation:**
- Should/Ought to: Further research should explore... (İleri araştırmalar incelemeli...)

**Necessity:**
- Must: Researchers must consider... (Araştırmacılar dikkate almalı...)

**Possibility:**
- Can/May: This can be explained by... (Bu ... ile açıklanabilir.)

**YDS Soru Örnekleri:**

1. **Anlam farkı soruları:**
"The scientist's use of 'might' rather than 'must' suggests:"
(a) absolute certainty
(b) tentative conclusion
(c) impossibility
(d) obligation
(e) permission

**Cevap: (b)** - 'Might' belirsizlik/ihtimal, 'must' kesinlik ifade eder.

2. **Uygun modal seçme:**
"Researchers ------- consider ethical implications before conducting experiments."
(a) could
(b) might
(c) must
(d) would
(e) can

**Cevap: (c)** - Etik değerlendirme zorunluluktur.

sections.title: Common Mistakes (Sık Yapılan Hatalar)
sections.content:
**1. Modal sonrası 'to' kullanmak:**
- ✗ She must to study.
- ✓ She must study.

**2. Modal verblere -s/-es eklemek:**
- ✗ He cans speak French.
- ✓ He can speak French.

**3. İki modal peş peşe kullanmak:**
- ✗ She will can come.
- ✓ She will be able to come.

**4. Mustn't ve don't have to karıştırmak:**
- ✗ You mustn't come if you're busy. (Yanlış - yasak anlamı verir)
- ✓ You don't have to come if you're busy. (Zorunlu değilsin.)

**5. Could have ile was able to karıştırmak:**
- I could swim = Genel yetkinlik (o dönemde yüzebilirdim)
- I was able to swim across the lake = Belirli başarı (gölü yüzerek geçebildim)

**6. Should have ile had to karıştırmak:**
- Should have = Tavsiye, pişmanlık (yapmalıydım ama yapmadım)
- Had to = Zorunluluktu (yapmak zorunda kaldım ve yaptım)

**7. May be ile maybe karıştırmak:**
- May be = Modal + verb (olabilir)
  - It may be true. (Doğru olabilir.)
- Maybe = Adverb (belki)
  - Maybe it's true. (Belki doğrudur.)

**8. Kesinlik derecelerini yanlış kullanmak:**
- ✗ It might definitely happen. (Çelişki - might=belirsiz, definitely=kesin)
- ✓ It will definitely happen.
- ✓ It might possibly happen.

sections.title: Practice Exercises
sections.content:
**Exercise 1: Choose the correct modal**

1. Students ------- wear uniforms at this school. It's a rule.
   (a) must (b) should (c) might (d) could (e) would

2. She ------- have finished the report by now. She started yesterday.
   (a) can (b) must (c) would (d) shall (e) may

3. You ------- have told me earlier! Now it's too late.
   (a) must (b) will (c) should (d) may (e) can

4. I ------- speak Spanish when I was younger, but I've forgotten most of it.
   (a) could (b) can (c) must (d) should (e) would

5. The results ------- be ready by Friday, according to the lab.
   (a) must (b) should (c) might (d) could (e) would

**Exercise 2: Past modals**

6. She ------- left early because her car is not in the parking lot.
   (a) should have (b) must have (c) could have (d) would have (e) might

7. We ------- taken a taxi. We're very late now.
   (a) must (b) should have (c) can (d) will (e) may have

8. He ------- stolen the money. He was with me all day.
   (a) must have (b) should have (c) can't have (d) might have (e) would have

**Exercise 3: Meaning distinction**

9. "Researchers must consider ethical implications" suggests:
   (a) possibility (b) obligation (c) permission (d) ability (e) advice

10. The use of "might" in "This might explain the anomaly" indicates:
    (a) certainty (b) impossibility (c) tentative suggestion (d) prohibition (e) necessity

**Answer Key:**
1. (a) must - rule/obligation
2. (b) must - logical deduction (kesin çıkarım)
3. (c) should - criticism/regret
4. (a) could - past general ability
5. (b) should - expectation
6. (b) must have - past deduction
7. (b) should have - past advice/regret
8. (c) can't have - past impossibility
9. (b) obligation
10. (c) tentative suggestion

sections.title: Reported Speech Nedir?
sections.content: Reported Speech (Indirect Speech / Dolaylı Anlatım), birinin söylediği bir şeyi kendi kelimelerimizle aktarmaktır. YDS'de hem gramer soruları hem de okuma parçalarında paraphrase (yeniden ifade etme) becerisini test eder.
sections.turkish_explanation: Türkçe'de '-dığını/-diğini' yapısıyla ifade edilen reported speech, İngilizce'de zaman değişimleri (backshift) ve kelime değişiklikleri gerektirir.

sections.title: Direct vs Reported Speech
sections.content:
**Direct Speech (Doğrudan Anlatım):**
Birinin tam olarak söylediği kelimeler tırnak içinde verilir:
- She said, "I am studying for the exam."
- He told me, "I will call you tomorrow."

**Reported Speech (Dolaylı Anlatım):**
Söylenen şey kendi kelimelerimizle, genellikle zaman değişimiyle aktarılır:
- She said (that) she was studying for the exam.
- He told me (that) he would call me the next day.

**Temel Farklar:**
1. Tırnak işaretleri kaldırılır
2. 'That' bağlacı kullanılır (isteğe bağlı)
3. Zamirler değişir (I → he/she, you → I/we, etc.)
4. Zamanlar geriye kayar (backshift)
5. Zaman/yer belirteçleri değişir

sections.title: Tense Changes (Backshift / Zaman Kayması)
sections.content:
Reporting verb (said, told, etc.) geçmiş zamandaysa, reported clause'daki zaman da geriye kayar:

**Present → Past:**
- Simple Present → Simple Past
  - Direct: "I work here."
  - Reported: He said he worked there.

- Present Continuous → Past Continuous
  - Direct: "I am working."
  - Reported: He said he was working.

- Present Perfect → Past Perfect
  - Direct: "I have finished."
  - Reported: He said he had finished.

**Past → Past Perfect:**
- Simple Past → Past Perfect
  - Direct: "I saw him yesterday."
  - Reported: She said she had seen him the day before.

- Past Continuous → Past Perfect Continuous
  - Direct: "I was reading."
  - Reported: He said he had been reading.

**Future → Conditional (would):**
- Will → Would
  - Direct: "I will help you."
  - Reported: He said he would help me.

- Am/is/are going to → Was/were going to
  - Direct: "I am going to travel."
  - Reported: She said she was going to travel.

**Modals Change:**
- Can → Could
  - Direct: "I can speak French."
  - Reported: He said he could speak French.

- May → Might
  - Direct: "It may rain."
  - Reported: He said it might rain.

- Must → Had to (zorunluluk) / Must (çıkarım için değişmez)
  - Direct: "I must go." → He said he had to go.
  - Direct: "He must be tired." → She said he must be tired.

- Shall → Should/Would
  - Direct: "Shall I help?" → He asked if he should help.

**DEĞİŞMEYEN MODALS:**
- Could, would, should, might, ought to → değişmez
- Past Perfect → değişmez (zaten en geçmiş zaman)
- Past Perfect Continuous → değişmez

sections.title: Time and Place Changes (Zaman ve Yer Değişiklikleri)
sections.content:
**Zaman İfadeleri (Time Expressions):**

| Direct Speech | Reported Speech |
|---------------|------------------|
| today | that day |
| tonight | that night |
| yesterday | the day before / the previous day |
| tomorrow | the next day / the following day |
| last week/month/year | the week/month/year before |
| next week/month/year | the following week/month/year |
| now | then / at that moment |
| ago | before |
| this | that |
| these | those |
| here | there |

**Örnekler:**

1. **Today → that day:**
   - Direct: "I am leaving today."
   - Reported: She said she was leaving that day.

2. **Tomorrow → the next day:**
   - Direct: "I will call you tomorrow."
   - Reported: He said he would call me the next day.

3. **Yesterday → the day before:**
   - Direct: "I saw her yesterday."
   - Reported: He said he had seen her the day before.

4. **Ago → before:**
   - Direct: "I met him two years ago."
   - Reported: She said she had met him two years before.

5. **Here → there:**
   - Direct: "I work here."
   - Reported: He said he worked there.

**DİKKAT:** Bu değişiklikler yalnızca bağlam gerektiriyorsa yapılır. Aynı gün söyleniyorsa 'today' değişmeyebilir.

sections.title: Reporting Verbs (Aktarma Fiilleri)
sections.content:
**Say vs Tell:**

- **Say:** Genellikle 'to' almaz (say something)
  - She said (that) she was tired.
  - He said, "I'm leaving."

- **Tell:** Dolaysız nesne gerektirir (tell someone something)
  - She told me (that) she was tired.
  - ✗ She told (that) she was tired. (Yanlış)
  - He told us the story.

**Other Reporting Verbs:**

Farklı reporting verbs farklı yapılar kullanır:

**1. Verb + (that) clause:**
- Say, tell, explain, mention, announce, claim, suggest
  - He explained (that) the system was complex.
  - She claimed (that) she had seen the incident.

**2. Verb + object + (that) clause:**
- Tell, remind, inform, assure, convince
  - She reminded me (that) the deadline was near.
  - He informed us (that) the meeting was cancelled.

**3. Verb + infinitive:**
- Agree, refuse, offer, promise, threaten, decide
  - She agreed to help.
  - He refused to answer.
  - They promised to come.

**4. Verb + object + infinitive:**
- Tell, ask, advise, warn, encourage, persuade, remind, invite
  - She told me to wait.
  - He advised her to study harder.
  - They invited us to join them.

**5. Verb + -ing:**
- Suggest, admit, deny, recommend
  - He suggested going to the park.
  - She admitted making a mistake.
  - They denied stealing the money.

**6. Verb + preposition + -ing:**
- Apologize for, insist on, complain about, object to
  - He apologized for being late.
  - She insisted on paying.
  - They complained about working long hours.

sections.title: Reporting Questions (Soruları Aktarma)
sections.content:
**Yes/No Questions:**

Soru kelimesi yoksa 'if' veya 'whether' kullanılır:

- Direct: "Do you like coffee?"
- Reported: He asked me if/whether I liked coffee.

- Direct: "Have you finished?"
- Reported: She asked me if/whether I had finished.

- Direct: "Will you help me?"
- Reported: He asked me if/whether I would help him.

**Wh- Questions:**

Soru kelimesi (what, where, when, why, who, how) korunur:

- Direct: "What are you doing?"
- Reported: She asked me what I was doing.

- Direct: "Where do you live?"
- Reported: He asked me where I lived.

- Direct: "When will you arrive?"
- Reported: She asked me when I would arrive.

- Direct: "Why did you leave?"
- Reported: He asked me why I had left.

**ÖNEMLİ KURALLAR:**

1. **Soru cümle yapısı → Düz cümle yapısına dönüşür:**
   - Direct: "Where do you work?" (soru sırası)
   - Reported: He asked where I worked. (özne + fiil sırası)

2. **Yardımcı fiiller kaldırılır:**
   - Direct: "Do you know him?" (do kaldırılır)
   - Reported: She asked if I knew him.

3. **Ask kullanımı:**
   - Ask + object + if/whether
   - Ask + object + wh- word
   - ✗ Ask that (kullanılmaz)

**Örnekler:**

1. "Are you coming to the party?"
   → He asked me if/whether I was coming to the party.

2. "What time does the train leave?"
   → She asked what time the train left.

3. "How long have you been waiting?"
   → He asked how long I had been waiting.

4. "Who broke the window?"
   → She asked who had broken the window.

sections.title: Reporting Commands and Requests (Emir ve Ricaları Aktarma)
sections.content:
**Commands (Emirler):**

Emir cümleleri 'to + infinitive' yapısıyla aktarılır:

**Tell/Order/Command + object + to infinitive:**

- Direct: "Close the door."
- Reported: He told me to close the door.

- Direct: "Be quiet!"
- Reported: She ordered us to be quiet.

- Direct: "Don't be late."
- Reported: He told me not to be late.

**Requests (Rica):**

Rica cümleleri de 'to + infinitive' ile aktarılır:

**Ask/Request/Beg + object + to infinitive:**

- Direct: "Please help me."
- Reported: She asked me to help her.

- Direct: "Could you open the window?"
- Reported: He asked me to open the window.

- Direct: "Would you mind waiting?"
- Reported: She asked me to wait.

**Advice (Tavsiye):**

**Advise/Recommend/Suggest + (object) + to infinitive / that clause:**

- Direct: "You should study harder."
- Reported: He advised me to study harder.
- Alternative: He advised that I (should) study harder.

- Direct: "Why don't we take a break?"
- Reported: She suggested taking a break.
- Alternative: She suggested that we (should) take a break.

**Warnings (Uyarı):**

**Warn + object + to infinitive / not to infinitive:**

- Direct: "Don't touch that!"
- Reported: He warned me not to touch that.

- Direct: "Be careful!"
- Reported: She warned me to be careful.

**Offers (Teklif):**

**Offer + to infinitive:**

- Direct: "I'll help you."
- Reported: He offered to help me.

- Direct: "Shall I carry your bag?"
- Reported: He offered to carry my bag.

**Promises (Söz):**

**Promise + to infinitive:**

- Direct: "I'll finish it by tomorrow."
- Reported: She promised to finish it by the next day.

**Refusals (Red):**

**Refuse + to infinitive:**

- Direct: "I won't do it."
- Reported: He refused to do it.

sections.title: Special Cases and Exceptions
sections.content:
**1. Genel Doğrular (Backshift Gerekmez):**

Evrensel doğrular ve hala geçerli durumlar için zaman değişmeyebilir:

- "The Earth revolves around the Sun."
  - He said the Earth revolves around the Sun. (genel doğru)
  - He said the Earth revolved around the Sun. (de doğru)

- "I live in Istanbul." (hala orada yaşıyorsa)
  - She said she lives in Istanbul. (hala doğru)
  - She said she lived in Istanbul. (de doğru)

**2. Mixed Time References:**

Farklı zaman referansları birleşebilir:

- "I bought this car last year and I still drive it."
  - He said he had bought that car the year before and he still drove it.

**3. Modal Perfects (Değişmez):**

- "I should have studied harder."
  - He said he should have studied harder.

- "She must have forgotten."
  - He said she must have forgotten.

**4. Present Perfect Continuous → Past Perfect Continuous:**

- "I have been working here for five years."
  - He said he had been working there for five years.

**5. Unreal Conditionals (Değişmez):**

- "If I were rich, I would travel the world."
  - He said if he were rich, he would travel the world.

**6. Reporting Same Day:**

Aynı gün aktarılıyorsa zaman ifadeleri değişmeyebilir:

- Morning: "I'll see you this afternoon."
- Later that day: He said he will see me this afternoon. (değişmeyebilir)

**7. Say to Someone:**

'Say to' kullanımı resmi ve nadirdir, genellikle 'tell' tercih edilir:

- He said to me (that) he was tired. (eski/resmi)
- He told me (that) he was tired. (modern/yaygın)

sections.title: Common Mistakes (Sık Yapılan Hatalar)
sections.content:
**1. Say ile tell karıştırmak:**
- ✗ She said me that... (Yanlış)
- ✓ She told me that...
- ✓ She said that...

**2. Zaman kayması unutmak:**
- ✗ He said he is tired. (Yanlış - rapor geçmişteyse)
- ✓ He said he was tired.

**3. Soru yapısını korumak:**
- ✗ She asked where do I live. (Yanlış - soru yapısı)
- ✓ She asked where I lived. (Düz cümle yapısı)

**4. 'If' veya 'whether' kullanmamak:**
- ✗ He asked did I like it. (Yanlış)
- ✓ He asked if/whether I liked it.

**5. Yanlış reporting verb yapısı:**
- ✗ He suggested to go. (Yanlış)
- ✓ He suggested going.
- ✗ He advised to study. (Eksik)
- ✓ He advised me to study.

**6. Yer ve zaman belirteçlerini değiştirmemek:**
- ✗ He said he would come here tomorrow. (Bağlama göre yanlış olabilir)
- ✓ He said he would come there the next day.

**7. 'That' ile 'to' karıştırmak:**
- ✗ He told me to he was busy. (Yanlış)
- ✓ He told me that he was busy.
- ✗ He promised that help. (Yanlış)
- ✓ He promised to help.

**8. Question words ile 'if' karıştırmak:**
- ✗ She asked if what I wanted. (Yanlış)
- ✓ She asked what I wanted.

**9. Zaman ifadelerini yanlış değiştirmek:**
- ✗ "I saw him yesterday" → He said he saw him the next day. (Yanlış)
- ✓ He said he had seen him the day before.

**10. Suggest kullanımı:**
- ✗ He suggested me to go. (Yanlış)
- ✓ He suggested that I (should) go.
- ✓ He suggested going.

sections.title: YDS Practice Exercises
sections.content:
**Exercise 1: Convert to Reported Speech**

1. "I am studying for my exams," she said.
   → She said ________.

2. "I will call you tomorrow," he told me.
   → He told me ________.

3. "Have you finished your homework?" the teacher asked.
   → The teacher asked ________.

4. "Where do you work?" she asked him.
   → She asked him ________.

5. "Don't be late," my mother told me.
   → My mother told me ________.

**Exercise 2: Choose the correct option**

6. She ------- me that she had already seen the movie.
   (a) said (b) told (c) asked (d) spoke (e) talked

7. He asked me ------- I could help him with the project.
   (a) that (b) if (c) what (d) to (e) which

8. The professor ------- us to submit the assignment by Friday.
   (a) said (b) spoke (c) told (d) talked (e) mentioned

9. "I'm going to Paris next month," she said.
   → She said she ------- to Paris the following month.
   (a) is going (b) was going (c) will go (d) would go (e) goes

10. "Where have you been?" he asked.
    → He asked where --------.
    (a) have I been (b) I have been (c) had I been (d) I had been (e) I was

**Exercise 3: Error Correction**

11. She said me that she was tired. → ________
12. He asked did I want some coffee. → ________
13. They told that they would come. → ________
14. She suggested to take a break. → ________
15. He asked what was I doing. → ________

**Answer Key:**
1. she was studying for her exams
2. he would call me the next day
3. if/whether I had finished my homework
4. where he worked
5. not to be late
6. (b) told - told + object
7. (b) if - yes/no question
8. (c) told - told + object + to infinitive
9. (b) was going - backshift
10. (d) I had been - question order + backshift
11. She told me / She said that
12. He asked if/whether I wanted
13. They said that / They told us that
14. She suggested taking
15. He asked what I was doing

sections.title: Infinitive ve Gerund Nedir?
sections.content:
**Infinitive (To-mastar):** 'To + verb' yapısıdır (to go, to study, to work)

**Gerund (-ing fiilimsi):** Verb + -ing yapısıdır (going, studying, working)

İkisi de isim gibi kullanılabilir ancak hangi fiil veya yapıdan sonra hangisinin geleceği kurallarla belirlenir. YDS'de bu konu hem gramer hem de okuma sorularında sık sık test edilir.
sections.turkish_explanation: Türkçe'de fiilimsiler '-mek/-mak' (gitmek, çalışmak) ekleriyle yapılır. İngilizce'de ise bazı durumlarda 'to go', bazı durumlarda 'going' kullanılır. Bu seçim belirli kurallara bağlıdır.

sections.title: Verbs Followed by Infinitive
sections.content:
**Sadece TO-INFINITIVE alan fiiller:**

Bu fiiller sonrasında MUTLAKA 'to + verb' gelir:

**Common Verbs + to-infinitive:**
- **Agree** (kabul etmek): I agreed to help him.
- **Decide** (karar vermek): She decided to study abroad.
- **Expect** (beklemek): We expect to arrive soon.
- **Hope** (ummak): They hope to pass the exam.
- **Plan** (planlamak): He plans to visit next month.
- **Promise** (söz vermek): She promised to call me.
- **Refuse** (reddetmek): He refused to answer.
- **Want** (istemek): I want to learn English.
- **Wish** (dilemek): She wishes to travel.
- **Offer** (teklif etmek): He offered to help.
- **Manage** (başarmak): She managed to finish on time.
- **Afford** (gücü yetmek): We can't afford to buy it.
- **Fail** (başarısız olmak): He failed to complete the task.
- **Learn** (öğrenmek): I learned to swim.
- **Need** (ihtiyaç duymak): You need to rest.
- **Prepare** (hazırlamak): They prepared to leave.
- **Seem** (görünmek): He seems to understand.
- **Tend** (eğilimli olmak): She tends to worry.
- **Threaten** (tehdit etmek): He threatened to quit.
- **Appear** (görünmek): They appear to be happy.
- **Choose** (seçmek): She chose to stay.
- **Deserve** (hak etmek): You deserve to win.
- **Hesitate** (tereddüt etmek): Don't hesitate to ask.
- **Pretend** (numara yapmak): He pretended to be sick.

**Örnekler:**
1. We decided to postpone the meeting.
   (Toplantıyı ertelemeye karar verdik.)

2. She hopes to graduate next year.
   (Gelecek yıl mezun olmayı umuyor.)

3. They refused to accept the offer.
   (Teklifi kabul etmeyi reddettiler.)

4. He managed to solve the problem.
   (Problemi çözmeyi başardı.)

5. I can't afford to waste time.
   (Zaman harcamayı göze alamam.)

sections.title: Verbs Followed by Gerund
sections.content:
**Sadece GERUND (-ing) alan fiiller:**

Bu fiiller sonrasında MUTLAKA 'verb + -ing' gelir:

**Common Verbs + gerund:**
- **Admit** (itiraf etmek): He admitted stealing the money.
- **Avoid** (kaçınmak): She avoids eating junk food.
- **Consider** (düşünmek): We're considering moving abroad.
- **Deny** (inkar etmek): He denied breaking the window.
- **Enjoy** (hoşlanmak): I enjoy reading novels.
- **Finish** (bitirmek): She finished writing the report.
- **Mind** (sakıncası olmak): Do you mind waiting?
- **Miss** (özlemek): I miss living in Istanbul.
- **Practice** (pratik yapmak): You should practice speaking.
- **Quit** (bırakmak): He quit smoking.
- **Suggest** (önermek): I suggest taking a break.
- **Dislike** (hoşlanmamak): She dislikes working late.
- **Imagine** (hayal etmek): Can you imagine living there?
- **Keep** (devam etmek): He kept talking.
- **Postpone** (ertelemek): They postponed making a decision.
- **Recommend** (tavsiye etmek): I recommend reading this book.
- **Risk** (riske atmak): Don't risk losing everything.
- **Can't help** (kendini tutamamak): I can't help laughing.
- **Can't stand** (dayanamamak): I can't stand waiting.
- **Feel like** (canı istemek): I don't feel like going out.
- **Give up** (vazgeçmek): He gave up trying.
- **Put off** (ertelemek): Don't put off studying.

**Örnekler:**
1. He admitted making a mistake.
   (Hata yaptığını itiraf etti.)

2. We enjoy spending time together.
   (Birlikte zaman geçirmekten hoşlanırız.)

3. She avoided answering the question.
   (Soruyu cevaplamaktan kaçındı.)

4. I miss seeing my family.
   (Ailemi görmeyi özlüyorum.)

5. They suggested going to the cinema.
   (Sinemaya gitmeyi önerdiler.)

sections.title: Verbs Followed by Both (Anlam Değişimi YOK)
sections.content:
Bazı fiiller hem infinitive hem gerund alabilir ve anlam DEĞİŞMEZ:

**1. Begin (başlamak):**
- It began to rain. = It began raining.
  (Yağmur yağmaya başladı.)

**2. Start (başlamak):**
- She started to laugh. = She started laughing.
  (Gülmeye başladı.)

**3. Continue (devam etmek):**
- He continued to work. = He continued working.
  (Çalışmaya devam etti.)

**4. Love (sevmek):**
- I love to read. = I love reading.
  (Okumayı severim.)

**5. Like (hoşlanmak):**
- She likes to swim. = She likes swimming.
  (Yüzmekten hoşlanır.)

**6. Hate (nefret etmek):**
- I hate to wait. = I hate waiting.
  (Beklemekten nefret ederim.)

**7. Prefer (tercih etmek):**
- I prefer to walk. = I prefer walking.
  (Yürümeyi tercih ederim.)

**8. Intend (niyet etmek):**
- We intend to stay. = We intend staying. (daha az yaygın)
  (Kalmayı planlıyoruz.)

**DİKKAT:**
- Gerund genellikle genel tercihi ifade eder
- Infinitive genellikle belirli bir durumu ifade eder

Ancak bu fark çok küçüktür ve genellikle birbirinin yerine kullanılabilir.

sections.title: Verbs Followed by Both (Anlam DEĞİŞİR)
sections.content:
Bazı fiiller hem infinitive hem gerund alır ancak anlam DEĞİŞİR:

**1. REMEMBER:**

- **Remember + to-infinitive** = Hatırlamak (gelecek eylem)
  - Remember to lock the door. (Kapıyı kilitlemeyi unutma.)
  - Yapılması gereken bir şeyi hatırlamak

- **Remember + gerund** = Hatırlamak (geçmiş eylem)
  - I remember locking the door. (Kapıyı kilitlediğimi hatırlıyorum.)
  - Geçmişte yaptığı bir şeyi hatırlamak

**2. FORGET:**

- **Forget + to-infinitive** = Unutmak (yapılmadı)
  - I forgot to call him. (Onu aramayı unuttum - aramadım.)

- **Forget + gerund** = Unutmak (geçmişte yapılanı)
  - I'll never forget meeting her. (Onunla tanışmayı asla unutmam.)

**3. REGRET:**

- **Regret + to-infinitive** = Üzülerek söylemek (resmi)
  - I regret to inform you that... (Üzülerek bildiririm ki...)
  - Şu anda yapılan eylemden dolayı üzülme

- **Regret + gerund** = Pişman olmak (geçmiş)
  - I regret not studying harder. (Daha çok çalışmadığıma pişmanım.)

**4. TRY:**

- **Try + to-infinitive** = Çabalamak, denemek
  - I tried to open the door. (Kapıyı açmaya çalıştım - zor oldu.)
  - Zor bir şeyi başarmaya çalışmak

- **Try + gerund** = Denemek (farklı yöntem)
  - Try pressing this button. (Bu düğmeye basmayı dene.)
  - Alternatif yöntem denemek

**5. STOP:**

- **Stop + to-infinitive** = Durmak (başka bir şey yapmak için)
  - I stopped to rest. (Dinlenmek için durdum.)
  - Bir aktiviteyi bırakıp başka bir şey yapmak

- **Stop + gerund** = Bırakmak, durdurmak
  - I stopped smoking. (Sigara içmeyi bıraktım.)
  - Bir aktiviteyi tamamen bırakmak

**6. GO ON:**

- **Go on + to-infinitive** = Devam etmek (farklı şeye)
  - He went on to become a doctor. (Doktor olmaya devam etti - sonra doktor oldu.)

- **Go on + gerund** = Devam etmek (aynı şeye)
  - He went on talking. (Konuşmaya devam etti.)

**7. MEAN:**

- **Mean + to-infinitive** = Niyet etmek
  - I didn't mean to hurt you. (Seni incitmek istemedim.)

- **Mean + gerund** = Anlamına gelmek, gerektirmek
  - This means working harder. (Bu daha çok çalışmak anlamına gelir.)

**Karşılaştırma Örnekleri:**

1. **Remember:**
   - Remember to buy milk. (Süt almayı unutma - henüz almadın.)
   - I remember buying milk. (Süt aldığımı hatırlıyorum - aldım.)

2. **Try:**
   - I tried to lift the box. (Kutuyu kaldırmaya çalıştım - ağırdı.)
   - Try lifting with your legs. (Bacaklarınla kaldırmayı dene - alternatif yöntem.)

3. **Stop:**
   - She stopped to answer the phone. (Telefonu cevaplamak için durdu.)
   - She stopped answering the phone. (Telefonu cevaplamayı bıraktı.)

sections.title: Verb + Object + Infinitive
sections.content:
Bazı fiiller 'verb + object + to-infinitive' yapısını alır:

**Common Verbs:**
- **Tell:** She told me to wait.
- **Ask:** He asked me to help him.
- **Advise:** The doctor advised her to rest.
- **Allow:** They allowed us to leave early.
- **Encourage:** She encouraged me to apply.
- **Expect:** I expect you to be on time.
- **Invite:** They invited us to join them.
- **Order:** The officer ordered them to stop.
- **Permit:** The rules don't permit us to smoke.
- **Persuade:** He persuaded me to go.
- **Remind:** She reminded me to call.
- **Teach:** He taught me to drive.
- **Warn:** They warned us not to go.
- **Want:** I want you to listen.
- **Would like:** I'd like you to meet my friend.
- **Force:** They forced him to confess.
- **Enable:** This will enable you to succeed.
- **Get:** I'll get him to fix it. (have ile benzer)

**Örnekler:**

1. The teacher told us to study Chapter 5.
   (Öğretmen 5. bölümü çalışmamızı söyledi.)

2. She advised me to see a doctor.
   (Doktora gitmemi tavsiye etti.)

3. They invited us to attend the conference.
   (Konferansa katılmamızı davet ettiler.)

4. I want you to understand the importance of this.
   (Bunun önemini anlamanı istiyorum.)

5. He persuaded her to change her mind.
   (Fikrini değiştirmesi için onu ikna etti.)

**Olumsuz yapı: object + not + to-infinitive**

- She told me not to worry.
  (Endişelenmememi söyledi.)

- They warned us not to be late.
  (Geç kalmamamız konusunda bizi uyardılar.)

sections.title: Prepositions + Gerund
sections.content:
**Edatlardan (prepositions) sonra MUTLAKA gerund gelir:**

Preposition + verb yapısında fiil her zaman -ing alır:

**Common Patterns:**

**1. Interested in + gerund:**
- I'm interested in learning French.
  (Fransızca öğrenmekle ilgileniyorum.)

**2. Good/Bad at + gerund:**
- She's good at solving problems.
  (Problem çözmede iyidir.)

**3. Fond of + gerund:**
- He's fond of playing chess.
  (Satranç oynamayı sever.)

**4. Tired of + gerund:**
- I'm tired of waiting.
  (Beklemekten bıktım.)

**5. Afraid of + gerund:**
- She's afraid of flying.
  (Uçmaktan korkar.)

**6. Think about + gerund:**
- I'm thinking about changing jobs.
  (İş değiştirmeyi düşünüyorum.)

**7. Succeed in + gerund:**
- He succeeded in passing the exam.
  (Sınavı geçmeyi başardı.)

**8. Insist on + gerund:**
- She insisted on paying.
  (Ödeme konusunda ısrar etti.)

**9. Apologize for + gerund:**
- He apologized for being late.
  (Geç kaldığı için özür diledi.)

**10. Thank someone for + gerund:**
- Thank you for helping me.
  (Bana yardım ettiğin için teşekkürler.)

**11. Complain about + gerund:**
- They complained about working long hours.
  (Uzun saatler çalışmaktan şikayet ettiler.)

**12. Dream of/about + gerund:**
- She dreams of becoming a doctor.
  (Doktor olmayı hayal ediyor.)

**13. Look forward to + gerund:** (DİKKAT: 'to' edat!)
- I'm looking forward to seeing you.
  (Seni görmeyi dört gözle bekliyorum.)

**14. Object to + gerund:**
- I object to being treated this way.
  (Bu şekilde muamele görmeye itiraz ediyorum.)

**15. Be/Get used to + gerund:** (DİKKAT: 'to' edat!)
- I'm used to working alone.
  (Yalnız çalışmaya alışkınım.)

**Common Mistakes:**
- ✗ I'm interested in to learn French.
- ✓ I'm interested in learning French.

- ✗ I look forward to see you.
- ✓ I look forward to seeing you.

- ✗ She's good at to solve problems.
- ✓ She's good at solving problems.

sections.title: Special Structures
sections.content:
**1. TO as a Preposition (Edatlı 'to'):**

Bu yapılarda 'to' EDAT olduğu için sonrasında gerund gelir:

- **Look forward to + gerund:**
  - I look forward to meeting you.

- **Be/Get used to + gerund:**
  - I'm used to getting up early.
  - She got used to living alone.

- **Object to + gerund:**
  - I object to being interrupted.

- **Be accustomed to + gerund:**
  - He's accustomed to working long hours.

- **Be committed to + gerund:**
  - We're committed to improving quality.

- **Confess to + gerund:**
  - He confessed to stealing.

**KARŞILAŞTIRMA:**
- Used to + infinitive = Geçmiş alışkanlık (artık yok)
  - I used to smoke. (Eskiden içerdim, artık içmiyorum.)

- Be used to + gerund = Alışkın olmak (hala devam eden)
  - I'm used to smoking. (İçmeye alışkınım.)

**2. Worth + gerund:**
- This book is worth reading.
  (Bu kitap okunmaya değer.)
- It's not worth worrying about.
  (Endişelenmeye değmez.)

**3. Busy + gerund:**
- She's busy preparing for the exam.
  (Sınava hazırlanmakla meşgul.)

**4. Have difficulty/trouble + gerund:**
- I have difficulty understanding him.
  (Onu anlamakta zorlanıyorum.)
- She had trouble finding a job.
  (İş bulmakta zorlandı.)

**5. It's no use/good + gerund:**
- It's no use crying over spilled milk.
  (Olan oldu, ağlamanın faydası yok.)
- It's no good complaining.
  (Şikayet etmenin faydası yok.)

**6. Spend/Waste time + gerund:**
- He spends hours playing video games.
  (Saatlerce video oyunu oynayarak geçiriyor.)
- Don't waste time worrying.
  (Endişelenerek zaman harcama.)

**7. Can't help + gerund:**
- I can't help feeling sorry for him.
  (Ona acımaktan kendimi alamıyorum.)

**8. There's no point in + gerund:**
- There's no point in arguing.
  (Tartışmanın anlamı yok.)

**9. Make/Let + bare infinitive (to olmadan):**
- She made me wait. (Beni bekletti.)
- Let me help you. (Sana yardım edeyim.)
- ✗ She made me to wait. (Yanlış)

**10. See/Hear/Watch + object + bare infinitive/gerund:**
- I saw him leave. (Ayrılışını gördüm - tamamını)
- I saw him leaving. (Ayrılırken gördüm - bir kısmını)

sections.title: Common Mistakes (Sık Yapılan Hatalar)
sections.content:
**1. Yanlış yapı seçimi:**
- ✗ I enjoy to read. → ✓ I enjoy reading.
- ✗ She decided going. → ✓ She decided to go.
- ✗ He suggested to leave. → ✓ He suggested leaving.

**2. Edat sonrası to-infinitive:**
- ✗ I'm interested in to learn. → ✓ I'm interested in learning.
- ✗ She's good at to cook. → ✓ She's good at cooking.

**3. Look forward to ile hata:**
- ✗ I look forward to see you. → ✓ I look forward to seeing you.
  (Burada 'to' edattır!)

**4. Used to karıştırma:**
- ✗ I'm used to smoke. → ✓ I used to smoke. (geçmiş alışkanlık)
- ✗ I used to smoking. → ✓ I'm used to smoking. (alışkın olmak)

**5. Remember/Forget/Stop ile anlam hatası:**
- "I remembered to call" ≠ "I remembered calling"
- "I stopped to smoke" ≠ "I stopped smoking"

**6. Make/Let sonrası 'to' kullanma:**
- ✗ She made me to wait. → ✓ She made me wait.
- ✗ Let me to help. → ✓ Let me help.

**7. Suggest yapısı:**
- ✗ He suggested me to go. → ✓ He suggested (that) I go / going.

**8. Want yapısı:**
- ✗ I want that you come. → ✓ I want you to come.

**9. Finish yapısı:**
- ✗ I finished to write. → ✓ I finished writing.

**10. Mind yapısı:**
- ✗ Do you mind to wait? → ✓ Do you mind waiting?

**11. Worth yapısı:**
- ✗ It's worth to read. → ✓ It's worth reading.

**12. Spend time yapısı:**
- ✗ He spends time to play. → ✓ He spends time playing.

sections.content:

lessons.title: Relative Clauses (İlgi Zamirleri ile Yan Cümleler)

sections.title: Relative Clauses Nedir?
sections.content:
Relative clauses (ilgi cümleleri), bir ismi tanımlayan veya hakkında ek bilgi veren yan cümlelerdir. Who, which, that, whose, where, when gibi relative pronouns (ilgi zamirleri) ile başlar.

YDS'de relative clauses hem gramer sorularında hem de okuma parçalarında yoğun olarak kullanılır. Özellikle akademik metinlerde karmaşık relative clause yapıları sık görülür.
sections.turkish_explanation: Türkçe'de '-en/-an' sıfat-fiil eki ve 'ki' bağlacıyla yapılan yapılar İngilizce'de relative clauses ile karşılanır. 'Gelen adam' = 'The man who came', 'Masadaki kitap' = 'The book which is on the table'.

sections.title: Types of Relative Clauses
sections.content:
İki ana tür relative clause vardır:

**1. Defining Relative Clauses (Belirleyici / Kısıtlayıcı)**

İsmi tanımlar ve cümlenin anlamı için gereklidir. Virgül kullanılmaz:

- The student **who studies hard** will pass the exam.
  (Çok çalışan öğrenci sınavı geçecek.)
  - 'Who studies hard' hangi öğrenciyi kastettiğimizi belirtir
  - Bu bilgi olmadan cümle eksik kalır

- The book **that I borrowed** is very interesting.
  (Ödünç aldığım kitap çok ilginç.)
  - Hangi kitap olduğunu belirtir

**2. Non-Defining Relative Clauses (Belirleyici Olmayan / Açıklayıcı)**

Ek bilgi verir ama cümlenin temel anlamı için gerekli değildir. Virgül kullanılır:

- My brother, **who lives in London**, is a doctor.
  (Londra'da yaşayan kardeşim doktordur.)
  - 'Who lives in London' ek bilgidir
  - Kaldırılsa cümle hala anlamlı: 'My brother is a doctor.'

- Istanbul, **which is the largest city in Turkey**, has a rich history.
  (Türkiye'nin en büyük şehri olan İstanbul, zengin bir tarihe sahiptir.)
  - 'Which is the largest city' ek bilgidir

**Temel Farklar:**

| Defining | Non-Defining |
|----------|-------------|
| Virgül YOK | Virgül VAR |
| 'That' kullanılabilir | 'That' kullanılmaz |
| İsmi tanımlar | Ek bilgi verir |
| Çıkarılırsa anlam değişir | Çıkarılabilir |
| 'Who/which' yerine 'that' | Sadece who/which |

**YDS Önemi:**
YDS'de virgüllü ve virgülsüz relative clause arasındaki farkı anlamak kritiktir.

sections.title: Relative Pronouns: Who, Which, That
sections.content:
**WHO (Kişiler için):**

Özne veya nesne olarak kullanılır:

**Özne olarak:**
- The woman **who lives** next door is a teacher.
  (Yan evde yaşayan kadın öğretmendir.)
- Students **who study regularly** perform better.
  (Düzenli çalışan öğrenciler daha iyi performans gösterir.)

**Nesne olarak:**
- The man **(who) I met** yesterday was very friendly.
  (Dün tanıştığım adam çok samimiydi.)
  - Nesne olduğunda 'who' çıkarılabilir (defining clauses)

**WHICH (Nesneler/Hayvanlar için):**

**Özne olarak:**
- The book **which is** on the table is mine.
  (Masadaki kitap benimdir.)
- The theory **which explains** this phenomenon is complex.
  (Bu olguyu açıklayan teori karmaşıktır.)

**Nesne olarak:**
- The car **(which) I bought** last year is very reliable.
  (Geçen yıl aldığım araba çok güvenilir.)
  - Nesne olduğunda 'which' çıkarılabilir (defining clauses)

**THAT (Hem kişiler hem nesneler için):**

'That' defining relative clauses'da who/which yerine kullanılabilir:

- The man **that called** you is my boss. (= who called)
- The book **that I read** was interesting. (= which I read)

**THAT kullanımının tercih edildiği durumlar:**

1. **Superlative + that:**
   - She's the best teacher **that I've ever had**.

2. **First/last/only + that:**
   - This is the first time **that I've tried sushi**.
   - He's the only person **that understands** me.

3. **Everything/anything/nothing + that:**
   - I'll do everything **that I can** to help.
   - There's nothing **that we can** do.

4. **All + that:**
   - That's all **that I know**.

5. **Kişi + nesne birlikte:**
   - I met the author and the books **that** made him famous.

**THAT kullanılamaz:**

1. **Non-defining clauses'da:**
   - ✗ My brother, that lives in London, is a doctor.
   - ✓ My brother, who lives in London, is a doctor.

2. **Preposition sonrasında:**
   - ✗ The house in that I live...
   - ✓ The house in which I live... (resmi)
   - ✓ The house that/which I live in... (gayri resmi)

sections.title: Whose, Whom, Where, When
sections.content:
**WHOSE (İyelik - kimin/kimin):**

Sahiplik belirtir, hem kişiler hem nesneler için:

- The student **whose essay** won the prize is here.
  (Kompozisyonu ödül kazanan öğrenci burada.)
  - whose = the student's

- I met a woman **whose daughter** is a famous actress.
  (Kızı ünlü bir aktris olan bir kadınla tanıştım.)
  - whose = the woman's

- The company **whose products** I use is expanding.
  (Ürünlerini kullandığım şirket genişliyor.)
  - whose = the company's

**Yapı: whose + noun**
- ✗ The man whose car... (Doğru)
- ✗ The man whose... (Eksik - isim gerekli)

**WHOM (Resmi nesne durumu - kimi):**

Resmi yazıda 'who' yerine nesne olarak:

- The person **whom I called** didn't answer. (resmi)
  = The person who/that I called... (günlük)

- The professor **to whom I wrote** replied quickly. (resmi)
  = The professor who/that I wrote to... (günlük)

**Preposition + whom (çok resmi):**
- The person **to whom** you spoke is the manager.
- The colleague **with whom** I work is very helpful.

YDS'de 'whom' akademik metinlerde görülebilir ancak günlük kullanımda nadirdir.

**WHERE (Yer - nerede):**

Yer bildiren isimleri tanımlar:

- The city **where I was born** is very beautiful.
  (Doğduğum şehir çok güzel.)
  - where = in which

- The restaurant **where we ate** was excellent.
  (Yemek yediğimiz restoran mükemmeldi.)

- This is the house **where Shakespeare lived**.
  (Bu Shakespeare'in yaşadığı evdir.)

**Where = in/at/on which:**
- The building where I work = The building in which I work

**WHEN (Zaman - ne zaman):**

Zaman bildiren isimleri tanımlar:

- I remember the day **when we first met**.
  (İlk tanıştığımız günü hatırlıyorum.)
  - when = on which

- The year **when I graduated** was very special.
  (Mezun olduğum yıl çok özeldi.)

- Summer is the season **when most people travel**.
  (Yaz, çoğu insanın seyahat ettiği mevsimdir.)

**When = in/on/at which:**
- The year when I graduated = The year in which I graduated

**WHY (Sebep - neden):**

Sadece 'reason' kelimesinden sonra:

- The reason **why I called** is to invite you.
  (Aramamın sebebi seni davet etmek.)
  - why = for which

- That's the reason **why she left**.
  (Onun ayrılma sebebi bu.)

**Why genellikle çıkarılabilir:**
- The reason (why) I called = The reason I called

sections.title: Omitting Relative Pronouns (İlgi Zamirlerini Çıkarma)
sections.content:
**Defining relative clauses'da nesne konumundaki relative pronouns çıkarılabilir:**

**WHO/WHICH/THAT çıkarılabilir (nesne olduğunda):**

1. **Nesne durumu:**
   - The book (which/that) I read was excellent.
   - The man (who/that) I met was friendly.
   - The movie (which/that) we watched was boring.

2. **Özne durumu - ÇIKARILAMAZ:**
   - ✗ The man lives next door is a doctor. (Yanlış)
   - ✓ The man who lives next door is a doctor.

**Nasıl anlarız nesne mi özne mi?**

**Özne:** Relative pronoun'dan sonra doğrudan fiil gelir
- The man **who lives** here... (who = özne, çıkarılamaz)
- The book **which contains** this information... (which = özne, çıkarılamaz)

**Nesne:** Relative pronoun'dan sonra başka özne + fiil gelir
- The man **(who) I saw**... (I = özne, who = nesne, çıkarılabilir)
- The book **(which) he wrote**... (he = özne, which = nesne, çıkarılabilir)

**Örnekler:**

1. **Özne - çıkarılamaz:**
   - The woman who called you is waiting. ✓
   - ✗ The woman called you is waiting. (Anlam değişir)

2. **Nesne - çıkarılabilir:**
   - The woman (who) you called is waiting. ✓
   - The woman you called is waiting. ✓

3. **Preposition sonrası:**
   - The house (which) I live in... ✓ (gayri resmi)
   - The house in which I live... ✓ (resmi, çıkarılamaz)

**Non-defining clauses'da ASLA çıkarılmaz:**
- ✗ My brother, lives in London, is a doctor. (Yanlış)
- ✓ My brother, who lives in London, is a doctor.

**WHERE/WHEN/WHY genellikle çıkarılabilir:**
- The place (where) I was born...
- The day (when) we met...
- The reason (why) I called...

Ancak bunların yerine 'that' kullanılamaz:
- ✗ The place that I was born... (Yanlış)
- ✓ The place where I was born... veya The place I was born...

sections.title: Prepositions in Relative Clauses
sections.content:
Relative clauses'da edat kullanımının iki yolu vardır:

**1. Preposition at the end (Gayri Resmi):**

Edat cümle sonunda kalır, konuşma ve gayri resmi yazıda yaygın:

- The person **who I spoke to** was helpful.
  (Konuştuğum kişi yardımcıydı.)

- The house **which we live in** is very old.
  (İçinde yaşadığımız ev çok eski.)

- The topic **(that) I'm interested in** is linguistics.
  (İlgilendiğim konu dilbilimdir.)

**2. Preposition before relative pronoun (Resmi/Akademik):**

Edat relative pronoun'dan önce gelir, resmi yazıda tercih edilir:

- The person **to whom I spoke** was helpful.
  (Konuştuğum kişi yardımcıydı.)

- The house **in which we live** is very old.
  (İçinde yaşadığımız ev çok eski.)

- The topic **in which I'm interested** is linguistics.
  (İlgilendiğim konu dilbilimdir.)

**ÖNEMLİ KURALLAR:**

**1. Preposition önde ise:**
   - 'That' KULLANILAMAZ
   - ✗ The house in that we live... (Yanlış)
   - ✓ The house in which we live...

**2. Preposition önde ise:**
   - 'Who' yerine 'whom' kullanılır
   - ✓ The person to whom I spoke...
   - ✗ The person to who I spoke... (Yanlış)

**3. Preposition sonda ise:**
   - Who/which/that kullanılabilir
   - Relative pronoun çıkarılabilir
   - The person (who/that) I spoke to...

**Common Verb + Preposition Combinations:**

1. **Look for:**
   - The book (which) I'm looking for is here.
   - The book for which I'm looking is here. (resmi)

2. **Talk about:**
   - The issue (that) we talked about was important.
   - The issue about which we talked was important. (resmi)

3. **Work with:**
   - The colleague (who) I work with is very experienced.
   - The colleague with whom I work is very experienced. (resmi)

4. **Rely on:**
   - The data (that) we rely on is accurate.
   - The data on which we rely is accurate. (resmi)

5. **Agree with:**
   - The theory (which) I agree with is widely accepted.
   - The theory with which I agree is widely accepted. (resmi)

**YDS'de Kullanım:**

YDS okuma parçaları akademik olduğu için preposition + which/whom yapısı sık görülür:

- "The framework **within which** the study was conducted..."
- "The participants **to whom** the questionnaire was administered..."
- "The extent **to which** the results can be generalized..."

sections.title: Quantifiers in Relative Clauses
sections.content:
Relative clauses'da 'of which/whom' yapısıyla miktar belirteçleri kullanılır:

**All/Most/Many/Some/None/Both/Neither/Each + of + which/whom:**

**1. All of which/whom:**
- I read three books, **all of which** were interesting.
  (Üç kitap okudum, hepsi ilginçti.)

- She has two brothers, **all of whom** are doctors.
  (İki erkek kardeşi var, ikisi de doktor.)

**2. Most of which/whom:**
- There are 30 students in the class, **most of whom** are international.
  (Sınıfta 30 öğrenci var, çoğu uluslararası.)

- He wrote several papers, **most of which** were published.
  (Birkaç makale yazdı, çoğu yayınlandı.)

**3. Some of which/whom:**
- She suggested many ideas, **some of which** were very creative.
  (Birçok fikir önerdi, bazıları çok yaratıcıydı.)

- I invited 20 people, **some of whom** couldn't attend.
  (20 kişi davet ettim, bazıları katılamadı.)

**4. None of which/whom:**
- I tried several solutions, **none of which** worked.
  (Birkaç çözüm denedim, hiçbiri işe yaramadı.)

- They hired five candidates, **none of whom** lasted more than a year.
  (Beş aday işe aldılar, hiçbiri bir yıldan fazla kalmadı.)

**5. Both of which/whom:**
- She has two dogs, **both of which** are very friendly.
  (İki köpeği var, ikisi de çok sevimli.)

**6. Neither of which/whom:**
- I have two options, **neither of which** is ideal.
  (İki seçeneğim var, ikisi de ideal değil.)

**7. Many/Several of which/whom:**
- He made many claims, **several of which** were false.
  (Birçok iddiada bulundu, birkaçı yanlıştı.)

**8. Numbers + of which/whom:**
- There were 50 applicants, **15 of whom** were shortlisted.
  (50 başvuru vardı, 15'i son listeye alındı.)

- I have three siblings, **two of whom** live abroad.
  (Üç kardeşim var, ikisi yurtdışında yaşıyor.)

**The + superlative + of which/whom:**

- She wrote many novels, **the best of which** won an award.
  (Birçok roman yazdı, en iyisi ödül kazandı.)

- I visited several cities, **the most impressive of which** was Rome.
  (Birkaç şehir ziyaret ettim, en etkileyicisi Roma'ydı.)

**YDS'de Kullanım:**

Bu yapılar akademik yazıda çok yaygındır:

- "The study included 200 participants, **most of whom** were university students."
- "Three hypotheses were tested, **two of which** were confirmed."
- "Various factors were identified, **the most significant of which** was motivation."

sections.title: Common Mistakes (Sık Yapılan Hatalar)
sections.content:
**1. Non-defining clauses'da 'that' kullanmak:**
- ✗ My sister, that lives in Paris, is visiting.
- ✓ My sister, who lives in Paris, is visiting.

**2. Non-defining clauses'da virgül unutmak:**
- ✗ My brother who is a doctor lives in Istanbul.
  (Bu defining clause - 'doktor olan kardeşim' anlamı verir)
- ✓ My brother, who is a doctor, lives in Istanbul.
  (Non-defining - ek bilgi)

**3. Özne relative pronoun'u çıkarmak:**
- ✗ The man lives next door is friendly.
- ✓ The man who lives next door is friendly.

**4. 'Whose' sonrası isim unutmak:**
- ✗ The student whose I met...
- ✓ The student whose essay I read...
- ✓ The student who I met...

**5. Preposition önünde 'that' kullanmak:**
- ✗ The house in that I live...
- ✓ The house in which I live...
- ✓ The house that I live in...

**6. Preposition önünde 'who' kullanmak:**
- ✗ The person to who I spoke...
- ✓ The person to whom I spoke...
- ✓ The person who I spoke to...

**7. Where/when ile 'in/on' gereksiz kullanımı:**
- ✗ The city where I live in...
- ✓ The city where I live...
- ✓ The city in which I live...
- ✓ The city I live in...

**8. 'What' relative pronoun olarak kullanmak:**
- ✗ The book what I read... (Yanlış - 'what' relative pronoun değil)
- ✓ The book which/that I read...
- ✓ What I read... (= The thing that I read - 'what' farklı kullanım)

**9. Double subject hatası:**
- ✗ The man who he lives here... (İki özne: who ve he)
- ✓ The man who lives here...

**10. Defining ve non-defining karıştırma:**
- "I have two brothers. My brother who is a doctor lives in London."
  (Defining - doktor olan kardeşim, diğeri değil)
- "I have one brother. My brother, who is a doctor, lives in London."
  (Non-defining - tek kardeşim, ek bilgi)

**11. 'Which' cümlenin tamamını gösteremez (that kullanılır):**
- ✗ He passed the exam, which surprised everyone.
  (Belirsiz - sınav mı yoksa geçmesi mi şaşırttı?)
- ✓ He passed the exam, which was surprising.
- ✓ The fact that he passed surprised everyone.

AMA: Non-formal kullanımda 'which' bir cümleyi gösterebilir:
- She didn't come, which was disappointing. (yaygın ama informal)

**12. Time/place için yanlış relative pronoun:**
- ✗ The day which we met...
- ✓ The day when we met...
- ✓ The day on which we met...

sections.title: Advanced Structures for YDS
sections.content:
**1. Reduced Relative Clauses (Kısaltılmış İlgi Cümleleri):**

Relative pronoun + be çıkarılabilir:

**Active voice:**
- The students **who are studying** in the library... 
  → The students **studying** in the library...

- The book **which is lying** on the table...
  → The book **lying** on the table...

**Passive voice:**
- The research **which was conducted** in 2020...
  → The research **conducted** in 2020...

- The data **which were collected** from participants...
  → The data **collected** from participants...

**Adjectives:**
- People **who are interested** in science...
  → People **interested** in science...

**2. Participle Clauses:**

**Present participle (active meaning):**
- The man **standing** at the door is my uncle.
  (= who is standing)

**Past participle (passive meaning):**
- The letter **written** by Einstein was sold.
  (= which was written)

**3. To-infinitive in Relative Clauses:**

Gelecek anlamı veya gereklilik ifade eder:

- She's the first person **to arrive**.
  (= who arrived / who will arrive)

- There's a lot of work **to do**.
  (= that needs to be done)

- He's the best candidate **to hire**.
  (= that we should hire)

**4. What (= the thing that):**

'What' = 'the thing(s) that' anlamında kullanılır:

- **What** surprised me was his honesty.
  (= The thing that surprised me...)

- I don't understand **what** you mean.
  (= the thing that you mean)

- **What** he said was true.
  (= The thing that he said...)

DİKKAT: 'What' relative pronoun değildir, başlı başına bir yapıdır.

**5. Whoever/Whichever/Whatever:**

- **Whoever** arrives first can choose a seat.
  (= Anyone who arrives...)

- Take **whichever** book you want.
  (= any book that you want)

- **Whatever** you decide is fine.
  (= Anything that you decide...)

**6. Complex Preposition Structures:**

YDS'de görülen akademik yapılar:

- The extent **to which** the results apply...
  (Sonuçların uygulanabilir olduğu ölçü...)

- The degree **to which** participants agreed...
  (Katılımcıların hemfikir olduğu derece...)

- The manner **in which** the study was conducted...
  (Çalışmanın yürütülme biçimi...)

- The way **in which** language is acquired...
  (Dilin edinilme şekli...)

**7. Double Relative Clauses:**

- The woman **who called** and **who left a message** is my aunt.
  (Arayan ve mesaj bırakan kadın teyzemdir.)

- The book **which I bought** and **which I read** yesterday was excellent.
  (Dün aldığım ve okuduğum kitap mükemmeldi.)

sections.title: YDS Practice Exercises
sections.content:
**Exercise 1: Choose the correct relative pronoun**

1. The student ------- essay won first prize is here.
   (a) who (b) whose (c) which (d) whom (e) what

2. The city ------- I was born is very beautiful.
   (a) which (b) that (c) where (d) when (e) who

3. The reason ------- she left is still unclear.
   (a) which (b) why (c) where (d) when (e) whose

4. My brother, ------- lives in Paris, is visiting next week.
   (a) that (b) which (c) who (d) whose (e) whom

5. The book ------- I told you about is now available.
   (a) who (b) whose (c) what (d) which (e) where

**Exercise 2: Defining vs Non-defining**

6. Correct the punctuation if necessary:
   "My sister who is a doctor works at a hospital."

7. Correct the punctuation if necessary:
   "Students who work hard usually succeed."

8. Which is correct?
   (a) The Eiffel Tower that is in Paris is famous.
   (b) The Eiffel Tower, which is in Paris, is famous.

**Exercise 3: Advanced structures**

9. Reduce the relative clause:
   "The woman who is waiting in the lobby is my colleague."

10. Reduce the relative clause:
    "The data which were collected last year are reliable."

11. The study included 100 participants, ------- were university students.
    (a) most of which (b) most of whom (c) whose most (d) who most (e) that most

12. The person ------- you spoke is the manager.
    (a) to who (b) to whom (c) to that (d) which to (e) whose

**Exercise 4: Error correction**

13. Correct: "The house in that I live is very old."
14. Correct: "The man who he called me is waiting."
15. Correct: "My friend, that lives in London, is visiting."

**Exercise 5: YDS-style academic sentences**

16. Choose the best option:
"The extent ------- the theory can explain the phenomenon remains debatable."
(a) in which (b) to which (c) of which (d) at which (e) with which

17. Choose the best option:
"Researchers have identified several factors, ------- is motivation."
(a) the most important of which
(b) which the most important
(c) that the most important
(d) of which most important
(e) most important which

**Answer Key:**
1. (b) whose (iyelik)
2. (c) where (yer)
3. (b) why (sebep)
4. (c) who (non-defining, 'that' kullanılmaz)
5. (d) which (nesne)
6. Needs commas: "My sister, who is a doctor, works at a hospital." (tek kardeşse)
   OR no change if speaker has multiple sisters (defining)
7. Correct as is (defining clause)
8. (b) The Eiffel Tower, which is in Paris, is famous. (non-defining - tek Eiffel Tower var)
9. The woman waiting in the lobby is my colleague.
10. The data collected last year are reliable.
11. (b) most of whom (kişiler için)
12. (b) to whom (resmi, preposition + whom)
13. The house in which I live... / The house that I live in...
14. The man who called me is waiting. ('he' çıkarılmalı)
15. My friend, who lives in London, is visiting. ('that' → 'who')
16. (b) to which (extent to which = ölçü)
17. (a) the most important of which
